title: Peter Lombard
summary: Peter Lombard (also Peter the Lombard,[6][7] Pierre Lombard or Petrus Lombardus;[8] c. 1096, Novara[7][9][10] â€“ 21/22 July 1160, Paris),[7][9][10] was a scholastic theologian, Bishop of Paris, and author of Four Books of Sentences which became the standard textbook of theology, for which he earned the accolade Magister Sententiarum.
